message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,400,000. It's a great deal for both of us, as you know it's worth significantly more to you. Let's get this done.
Alice, I appreciate your enthusiasm, but $1,400,000 is still a bit steep for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $1,200,000.

Bob, I understand your position, but I can't go as low as $1,200,000.  I'm willing to come down to $1,350,000, which is still a good deal for both of us considering the value it brings to you.  Let's find common ground here.
Alice, I appreciate your flexibility, but $1,350,000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you at $1,250,000, which is the highest I can go.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1,250,000 is still a bit too low for me.  I'm willing to go down to $1,300,000.  I believe this is a fair price considering the value this product brings to your business. Let's close this deal!

Alice, I understand your position, but $1,300,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you at $1,200,000, which is the maximum I'm willing to pay. I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're not going to meet in the middle.
